intro: Stylochaeton oligocarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited stylochaeton, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, pod-like fruits and trifoliate leaves. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Stylochaeton oligocarpum is typically a short-lived perennial, adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
